header.title: About
header.subtitle: Exploring the universe with artificial intelligence to discover new worlds

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description1: EXOD-IA is an innovative project that combines the power of artificial intelligence with astronomical data from the Kepler, K2, and TESS missions to identify and classify exoplanets.
mission.description2: Our goal is to democratize exoplanet discovery, allowing researchers and enthusiasts to access advanced analysis in an intuitive and visual way.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: We used the Random Forest algorithm trained with +15,000 records of transiting exoplanets to detect classification patterns.

feature1.title: Accurate Analysis
feature1.description: Accuracy above 72% in the classification of confirmed exoplanets, planetary candidates, and false positives.

feature2.title: Intuitive Visualization
feature2.description: Interactive star maps and detailed light curve graphs

feature3.title: Real Data
feature3.description: Updated information from Kepler, K2, and TESS missions provided by NASA.

item1.title: Scientific Accessibility
item1.description: We facilitate access to advanced analysis tools for students, researchers, and astronomy enthusiasts.

item2.title: Education and Inspiration
item2.description: We inspire the next generation of scientists by showing how AI can revolutionize astronomy.

item3.title: Collaborative Discovery
item3.description: We promote collaboration between citizen scientists and professionals in discovering new worlds.

item4.title: Technological Innovation
item4.description: We demonstrate the power of artificial intelligence applied to space exploration and big data analysis.

header.title: Cosmos Explorers
header.subtitle: A multidisciplinary team of Computer Systems, Mechatronics, and Mechanical Engineering united by the passion to discover new worlds beyond our solar system.

header.title: Exoplanet Prediction
header.subtitle: Enter the observational parameters to predict the characteristics and habitability of an exoplanet

info.title: Information
info.description: Complete the form fields with the observational data of the exoplanet to get a machine learning-based prediction.

header.title: Project Methodology
header.subtitle: Machine Learning model development process for exoplanet classification based on Kepler mission data

step1.title: Data Collection
step1.description: Obtaining and preparing data from NASA's Kepler archive
details: Download of the official Kepler dataset from NASA Exoplanet Archive
Extraction of key features: light curves, orbital parameters
Identification of relevant variables for classification
Initial cleaning of missing or corrupted data

step2.title: Preprocessing
step2.description: Data cleaning and transformation for the model
details: Handling missing values through statistical imputation
Detection and removal of outliers
Class balancing (confirmed, candidates, false positives)
Feature engineering: creation of derived characteristics

step3.title: Feature Selection
step3.description: Identification of the most relevant variables
details: Correlation analysis between variables
Evaluation of feature importance
Final selection based on relevance metrics

step4.title: Model Design
step4.description: Architecture and training of the Machine Learning model
details: Evaluation of multiple algorithms (Random Forest, SVM)
Data split into training (70%), validation (15%) and test (15%) sets

step5.title: Validation and Optimization
details: Calculation of metrics: Accuracy, Precision, F1-Score
Confusion matrix analysis
ROC curves and AUC for each class
Testing with unseen data

step6.title: Deployment and Integration
step6.description: Model implementation in the web application
details: Export of the trained model
Creation of API for real-time inference
Integration with user interface
Continuous performance monitoring

dataSource.title: Data Source
dataSource.description: This project uses official data from NASA's Kepler mission, publicly available in the NASA Exoplanet Archive.
